Title: "Candles in the Ancient Air"

Circles of sorrow fading under night.
Layers intensifying the hallowed light.
Instilling peace where grief residue lies,
Fanning flames of memory to the skies.
Flickering messages, making history bright.
Orthodox, Reform, one candle's fight.
Resilience in wax, glowing quite right
Drenched in remembrance, their united might.
prompt: ‘The mood is subdued’: Hanukkah is marked by mourning for Jews across UK On Thursday evening, the small progressive Jewish community in York will gather at Jewbury, the city’s medieval Jewish cemetery, to light memorial candles and say prayers for 150 people who died in a 12th-century pogrom at Clifford’s Tower.
